channel.title: Team | Center of Complex Interventions
channel.description: Helping Communities Translate Science Into Action

item.title: Kriti Godey
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Kriti Godey manages technology at CCI. She spends the bulk of her time leading the Mathesar project, an open source product to help users of all skill levels work with data. Most recently, she was Director of Engineering at Creative Commons (CC), where she built open source tools to make CC licenses easier to work […]
item.content:encoded: Kriti Godey manages technology at CCI. She spends the bulk of her time leading the Mathesar project, an open source product to help users of all skill levels work with data. Most recently, she was Director of Engineering at Creative Commons (CC), where she built open source tools to make CC licenses easier to work with. Prior to that, she focused on leading happy and productive distributed engineering teams at startups, and has enjoyed architecting and building both consumer-facing and enterprise software.

item.title: Ondrej Holiencin
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Ondrej is an experienced IT architect, agile practitioner, certified scrum master, and consultant with a background in computer science and political economy. He participated in many international multimillion-dollar projects in finance, insurance, and banking. Ondrej works with the CCI operations team to set short-term and long-term goals for the organization and assists with project engagement […]
item.content:encoded:
Ondrej is an experienced IT architect, agile practitioner, certified scrum master, and consultant with a background in computer science and political economy. He participated in many international multimillion-dollar projects in finance, insurance, and banking.

Ondrej works with the CCI operations team to set short-term and long-term goals for the organization and assists with project engagement and the grant application process.

item.title: Adam Mullinax
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Adam Mullinax is the Chief Financial Officer of CCI where he manages the budgets and financials of the organization, while also working closely with the other team members to help with key organizational and strategic initiatives. Separately, Adam is an investor and partner at Neoteny, an early-stage venture capital firm with a broad focus across […]
item.content:encoded: Adam Mullinax is the Chief Financial Officer of CCI where he manages the budgets and financials of the organization, while also working closely with the other team members to help with key organizational and strategic initiatives. Separately, Adam is an investor and partner at Neoteny, an early-stage venture capital firm with a broad focus across technology. Adam has a BS in Finance from the New York University, with a minor in history. While not working, Adam enjoys cooking, playing golf and spending time with his family and cats.

item.title: Kate McCall-Kiley
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Kate McCall-Kiley is a complex system enthusiast helping to execute on special projects at CCI. Outside of that, she is a co-founder and director at xD, an experimental data lab within the US federal government. She also is a co-founder of the Space Governance Collaborative at MIT Media Lab, prototyping governance futures. Her work aims […]
item.content:encoded: Kate McCall-Kiley is a complex system enthusiast helping to execute on special projects at CCI. Outside of that, she is a co-founder and director at xD, an experimental data lab within the US federal government. She also is a co-founder of the Space Governance Collaborative at MIT Media Lab, prototyping governance futures. Her work aims to create new environments and mechanisms for behavior change while experimenting with different ways to productively challenge convention. Previously, Kate served the White House as a Presidential Innovation Fellow. She holds a Masterâ€™s in Design Leadership from Maryland Institute College of Art and an MBA from Johns Hopkins University; she also studied philosophy and psychology at The College of Wooster. In aspirational parallel lives, Kate would love to be a philosopher/ethicist, DJ, and participatory graffiti artist.

item.title: Ariel Ekblaw
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Ariel Ekblaw brings an interdisciplinary approach to her work at CCI, bridging “extreme environments” between Earth and Space. She advises the climate change mitigation, adaptation, and geoengineering research areas for CCI. Outside CCI, she is the founder and Director of the MIT Space Exploration Initiative and leads a space architecture research portfolio. Her work aims […]
item.content:encoded: Ariel Ekblaw brings an interdisciplinary approach to her work at CCI, bridging “extreme environments” between Earth and Space. She advises the climate change mitigation, adaptation, and geoengineering research areas for CCI. Outside CCI, she is the founder and Director of the MIT Space Exploration Initiative and leads a space architecture research portfolio. Her work aims to create new technologies and explore systems-level impact to empower humans in resource-constrained environments.

item.title: Rajat Vijay
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Rajat Vijay is a software engineer with a major inclination towards the frontend & JavaScript ecosystem. He enjoys simplifying user experiences by building accessible user interfaces. He has previously worked on Voice AI platforms & large scale workflow automation tools. In his free time he enjoys traveling and exploring products that track his body vitals.
item.content:encoded: Rajat Vijay is a software engineer with a major inclination towards the frontend & JavaScript ecosystem. He enjoys simplifying user experiences by building accessible user interfaces. He has previously worked on Voice AI platforms & large scale workflow automation tools. In his free time he enjoys traveling and exploring products that track his body vitals.

item.title: Peg Nottingham
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Margaret (Peg) Nottingham has been working in the online development world for over 25 years and has spent the past 15 focusing on User Interface (UI) and User Experience (UX) development and best practices.  Peg has been an artist and a tech early adopter since childhood; she won her first drawing contest in kindergarten and […]
item.content:encoded:
Margaret (Peg) Nottingham has been working in the online development world for over 25 years and has spent the past 15 focusing on User Interface (UI) and User Experience (UX) development and best practices. 

Peg has been an artist and a tech early adopter since childhood; she won her first drawing contest in kindergarten and learned how to program on an Apple //e in second grade. Working so closely with art and computers throughout her life, Peg believes that beauty isnâ€™t just visual, itâ€™s functional as well; you can have great beauty without technology, but you cannot have great technology if it doesnâ€™t function beautifully.

item.title: Joi Ito
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Joi Ito is an advisor to the CCI team and helps with several ongoing research projects. He is currently a partner at the venture capital firm, Neoteny, a guest researcher at Keio University’s Cyber Civilization Research Center and founder and board member of Digital Garage in Tokyo. He has had numerous roles in the past […]
item.content:encoded:
Joi Ito is an advisor to the CCI team and helps with several ongoing research projects.

He is currently a partner at the venture capital firm, Neoteny, a guest researcher at Keio University’s Cyber Civilization Research Center and founder and board member of Digital Garage in Tokyo.

He has had numerous roles in the past including Director of the MIT Media Lab, a Professor of Law from Practice at The Harvard Law School, Chair of PureTech Health, CEO of Creative Commons and board member of The New York Times Company, Sony Corporation, The MacArthur Foundation, The Knight Foundation, as well as The Mozilla Foundation, The Internet Corporation for Names and Numbers (ICANN) and the Open Source Initiative.

He earned his Ph.D. from the School of Media and Governance at Keio University and is co-author with Jeff Howe of Whiplash: How to Survive Our Faster Future (Grand Central Publishing, December 2016).

item.title: Isha Datar
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Isha is executive director of New Harvest, a nonprofit research institute that funds open, public cultured meat research. She has been pioneering cellular agriculture since 2009, driven by a passion to see transformative technology create a better world. In 2010, Isha published a review paper in the scientific journal Innovative Food Science and Emerging Technologies, […]
item.content:encoded: Isha is executive director of New Harvest, a nonprofit research institute that funds open, public cultured meat research. She has been pioneering cellular agriculture since 2009, driven by a passion to see transformative technology create a better world. In 2010, Isha published a review paper in the scientific journal Innovative Food Science and Emerging Technologies, among the first handful of papers to ever discuss cultured meat in academic literature. After co-founding Muufri (now Perfect Day Foods) and Clara Foods in 2014, she transferred her founding equity to New Harvest and used it to establish an endowment for cell ag research. In 2015, Isha coined the term “cellular agriculture” â€” officially creating a category for agriculture products produced from cell cultures rather than whole plants or animals. Isha is a Shuttleworth Foundation Fellow and Directorâ€™s Fellow at the MIT Media Lab. Isha holds a BSc. in cell and molecular biology from the University of Alberta and a master’s in biotechnology from the University of Toronto.

item.title: Daniel Begemann
item.dc:creator: Ondrej Holiencin
item.description: Daniel Begemann is a former CCI volunteer and policy simulator collaborator who is now working on CCIâ€™s policy simulator projects full-time. He has an MSc in Data Science from the University of Liverpool, where his dissertation focused on epilepsy detection using EEG data. Prior to this, Dan worked in nonprofit administration in Washington, DC, as […]
item.content:encoded: Daniel Begemann is a former CCI volunteer and policy simulator collaborator who is now working on CCIâ€™s policy simulator projects full-time. He has an MSc in Data Science from the University of Liverpool, where his dissertation focused on epilepsy detection using EEG data. Prior to this, Dan worked in nonprofit administration in Washington, DC, as well as at a public school. Dan is currently living in England. In his spare time, he enjoys volunteering, reading and writing, and playing sports.
